basics.name: Justin Turnau
basics.label: PhD Student, Research Assistant, and Teaching Assistant
basics.summary: PhD student in Computer Science with research interests in multi-agent reinforcement learning and sim-to-real transfer for reinforcement learning. Experienced in research, teaching, and mentoring.

work.name: Arizona State University
work.summary: Conducts research on sim-to-real techniques in multi-agent reinforcement learning and bridges the gap between simulation and reality.
highlights: Comprehensive literature review on sim-to-real transfer techniques.
Contributions to MARL research with evaluations on traffic signal control.
Exploration of MARL techniques and open challenges.

work.name: Arizona State University
work.summary: Supports teaching in graduate-level data mining with a focus on classification, model selection, and clustering.
highlights: Assisted in teaching data mining concepts, helped students through office hours.
Lectured on deep neural networks and transformer architecture.

work.name: University of Cincinnati
work.summary: Advanced explainable machine learning through provenance-based explanation methods.
highlights: Analyzed and implemented ML explanation methods.
Enhanced model explainability for classic supervised models.
Transformed ML queries into Datalog queries capturing provenance.

publications.name: Provenance-Based Explanations for Machine Learning (ML) Models
publications.summary: Presented at the International Workshop on Databases and Machine Learning (DBML 2023), focusing on provenance-based explanations for ML models.
